age labor is basically no different from child 
slavery except that it's temporary so the idea

that working for a wage is equivalent to slavery 
strikes me as actually deeply offensive you're

saying that one of the most evil things 
in American history is the same as you

choosing a place to work negotiating a wage and 
settling on it and doing that yeah except for

the part where you get paid you get to choose 
where you work you can leave if you don't like

the conditions and you're a free human being 
with rights and property if you can't see a

difference between wage labor which is voluntary 
and chattel slavery you've lost the plot thank you
